content: this is a summary of a legal case that took place in harju county court in estonia the court issued a final resolution after one year and three months the court ruled that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the specific amount was not specified the appellant is appealing a decision made by the appeal court and has 30 days to submit the appeal to the tallinn district court the appeal can be resolved in writing or through a hearing depending on the appellants request the claimant is seeking ownership of an apartment that was bought during their marriage and has provided evidence such as a divorce certificate and a statement of claim the defendant objects to the claim and argues that the money for the apartment was provided by their parents and that the claimant never contributed financially to the apartment the defendant has submitted evidence to support their objections and is asking the court to recognize the apartment as separate property or alternatively to distribute the property equally between the parties with a reduction in compensation awarded to the claimant the court examines various documents including certificates minutes of meetings bank statements and witness statements to determine the ownership of the apartment the court concludes that the apartment is the separate asset of the cooperative member and dismisses the daughters claim for division of ownership each party is responsible for their own procedural costs and the price of the civil case is determined to be 3500 euros for both parties the summary also mentions the involvement of a judge and refers to specific code articles relevant to the case
